column4: What the hell is wrong with Ubuntu iso servers? No only do they cut me off 2-5% into the download, but wget --trust-server-names http://www.ubuntu.com/start-download?distro=desktop&bits=64&release=latest also downloads to ubuntu-11.10-desktop-i386.iso which is what the 32 bit one should download to.
It is always highly recommended to use the torrent downloads, as it decreases load on the servers.
ok but thats not the point.
Load on the servers can cause that issue. To be honest, it's either a problem with your connection, or an overload on their servers. I know I never get over 3Mbps on their direct downloads.
no its got nothing to do with my connection
i get almost 6Mbps as I should
The only thing I can think of is server load. I personally never use direct downloads and so haven't had that issue for a long time.
I need to compile my program to work in all sorts of ubuntu versions, is this possible without installing each version in a vm?
I am unsure of how to create a .deb installer from a compiled source, however let me do a quick search and I'll return findings asap.
Is this what you're looking to do? http://www.webupd8.org/2010/01/how-to-create-deb-package-ubuntu-debian.html
very nice of you :] i can google too, but it would be better if an ubuntu user suggests some best-course-of-action, as a non-ubuntu user i wont know if what i find is the optimal way
I personally do use Ubuntu, however I don't have an extremely wide range of knowledge, I just know the basic things and know what to search for. =P
